newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israelis stop Arab stone-throwers in Hebron.
newsitem.headline: Israelis stop Arab stone-throwers in Hebron.

text.p: Israeli soldiers quickly stopped Palestinians from hurling stones at them during a brief confrontation in the heart of Hebron on Friday, witnesses said.

No one was hurt. Troops restored order in the area near the Arab market in the 20 percent of the West Bank town which remains under Israeli rule following a handover to PLO self-rule earlier in the day.
The incident took place near where on New Year's Day an Israeli off-duty soldier opened fire on the market, wounding seven Palestinians.
Each side blamed the other for the incident on Friday in the volatile town where 400 Jewish settlers live and study in the heart of 100,000 Arabs.

"I saw what happened. They threw stones. I saw the policemen, the soldiers, run after them," said Geula Cohen, a hardline former member of Israel's parliament who has lived in Hebron. "This is peace."
A Palestinian witness interviewed by Israel Radio accused Jewish settlers of starting the incident.
